009package imagingbook.common.util;
010
011import java.util.HashMap;
012import java.util.Objects;
013
014/**
015 * Defines a primitive mechanism for attaching arbitrary properties to an object at runtime. Objects of any type may be
016 * attached and no type checking is done at compile time, i.e., the required type casts are inherently unsafe. An
017 * implementing class only needs to define method {@link #getPropertyMap()}. The functionality is basically the same as
018 * {@link HashMap} but definition as an interface avoids having to subclass {@link HashMap}. Usage example:
019 * <pre>
020 *     public class Foo implements DynamicProperties {
021 *         ...
022 *     }
023 *
024 *     Foo f = new Foo();
025 *     double[] x = {1, 2, 3, 4};
026 *     f.setProperty("SomeDoubleArray", x);
027 *     ...
028 *     double[] y = (double[]) f.getProperty("SomeDoubleArray");
029 * </pre>
030 */
031public interface DynamicProperties {
032
033    /**
034     * The underlying hash map, to be instantiated by implementing classes.
035     */
036    public class PropertyMap extends HashMap<String, Object> {
037        public PropertyMap() {
038            super(4);   // start with up to 4 properties
039        }
040    }
041
042    /**
043     * Returns an instance of {@link PropertyMap} with keys of type {@link String} and values of type {@link Object}.
044     * Implementing classes must define this method, which will typically return a reference to a local map instance.
045     * The returned object must not be {@code null}.
046     *
047     * @return the {@link PropertyMap} associated with the implementing instance
048     */
049    public PropertyMap getPropertyMap();
050
051    /**
052     * Sets the specified property of this region to the given value.
053     * @param key the key of the property (may not be {@code null})
054     * @param value the value associated with this property (may not be {@code null})
055     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the supplied key or value is {@code null}
056     */
057    public default void setProperty(String key, Object value) {
058        if (Objects.isNull(key)) {
059            throw new IllegalArgumentException("property key must not be null");
060        }
061        if (Objects.isNull(value)) {
062            throw new IllegalArgumentException("property value must not be null");
063        }
064        getPropertyMap().put(key, value);
065    }
066
067    /**
068     * Retrieves the specified region property. {@link IllegalArgumentException} is thrown if the property is not
069     * defined.
070     *
071     * @param key the name of the property (may not be {@code null})
072     * @return the value of the associated property
073     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the supplied key is {@code null}
074     */
075    public default Object getProperty(String key) {
076        if (key == null) {
077            throw new IllegalArgumentException("property key must not be null");
078        }
079        return getPropertyMap().get(key);
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * Removes the property associated with the specified key if defined, otherwise does nothing.
084     * @param key the name of the property
085     */
086    public default void removeProperty(String key) {
087        getPropertyMap().remove(key);
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * Removes all properties.
092     */
093    public default void clearAllProperties() {
094        getPropertyMap().clear();
095    }
096
097}
